title: Kiss Me or I'll Die
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2xsZMsL

by suicide_candy_candy

summary: Summary: Based on a cute video on YouTube where a creative artist with a camera asks strangers to call up their crush  and ask...
body:
It’s A Date! (Tony Stark x Reader <2>)

Summary: Based on a cute video on YouTube where a creative artist with a camera asks strangers to call up their crush  and ask them out, while she records their reactions.

A/n: This would be my first Tony Stark fic so I’m hoping i got his characterization right! Let me know what you think about the reader and Tony. Also i noticed that though not purposefully, reader’s pronouns haven’t been specified, so I guess anybody could read these! 

“So how do you know him?”

“I met him on a vacation actually” you replied remembering his charm. “had a really nice conversation and all…”

“Tell me something about him!”

“He’s super rich, and I’m telling you this because he does a lot of charity. Saw it myself. And also because I’m scared, that he won’t remember me or have time to hang out. But he’s really awesome so I gotta tell him how I feel right?

“Yeah you totally should!”

“Okay let’s see.” You called his number waiting for him to pick up.

“Tony Stark speaking, who’s this?”

You shot the camera girl a nervous look, planning a response in your head.

“Hi, Tony, (Y/n)here. I don’t know if you remember me-”

“Y/n! it’s been a month! I thought you’d never call!” Tony spoke, his voice cool and confident .

He remembered me! Phew, at least there’s that.

“Yeah, I know. It’s kinda out of the blue but I was wondering-”

“You were wondering?” he asked, intrigued.

“- I was wondering if you’d want to go on a date with me?”

“Man, that was my line! Sure I’d go on a date with you! Is that even a question?! Text me the details.”

Your eyes widened in surprise and you high- fived the camera girl.

“I got a date!”

“Me too!” Tony squeaked on the other side, making you laugh.

“Bye, Tony!”

summary: “the captain marvel trailer sucked.. she looked emotionless and didn’t smile..”  “(...) [Brie Larson] won the Academy Award for...
body:
“the captain marvel trailer sucked.. she looked emotionless and didn’t smile..”

“(…) [Brie Larson] won the Academy Award for Best Actress, the BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Leading Role, the Critics’ Choice Movie Award for Best Actress, the Golden Globe Award for Best Actress in a Motion Picture – Drama, and the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role.”

blog.name: chucksnerdthoughts
blog.title: Chuck's Nerd Thoughts
blog.description: A place for all my nerdy thoughts.

title: Star Wars #53
body:
I really liked that. I’m always a fan of focus on Leia and I really enjoyed what she was doing here. With every mindless explosion, you could feel the weight in her voice. Even though we know our heroes are going to somehow escape, this event is going to haunt them, especially Leia. Its “her fault” this all happened because she trusted Trios. That’s why she’s willing to put her life on the line for the fleet. Yeah. This was great! All the action with Luke was also awesome. Especially the Tron light trail thing. I am quite excited to see how the story continues!

-Chuck

summary: El diablo regresa a Netflix en octubre con el primer trailer de Daredevil
title: El diablo regresa a Netflix en octubre con el primer trailer de Daredevil
body:
El diablo regresa a Netflix en octubre con el primer trailer de Daredevil

Después de darnos pistas en redes sociales, Netflix lanzó el primer avance en video de la nueva temporada de Marvel’s Daredevil.

Asumiendo la oscuridad, enfurecido por el mal que se avecina, el video anuncia el regreso de Matt Murdock … el vigilante.

Además, se han compartido dos nuevos pósters de la temporada próxima.

Y aquí el…

summary: PREVIEW: Check Out The New #DAREDEVIL Season 3 Poster and #Trailer Just Ahead of NYCC
title: PREVIEW: Check Out The New #DAREDEVIL Season 3 Poster and #Trailer Just Ahead of NYCC
body:
PREVIEW: Check Out The New #DAREDEVIL Season 3 Poster and #Trailer Just Ahead of NYCC

Netflix and Marvel have released the date for the premiere of the long long long awaited return of Daredevil for its third season.

The trailer above features Matt Murdock (Charlie Cox) narrating his character’s renewed mission against the evil plaguing Hell’s Kitchen. Season 3 looks to take its inspiration from the Marvel comics…

blog.name: princessamericachavez
blog.title: Your Ticket to the Multiverse
blog.description: Mexican 24. Journalist, writer, geek. Currently majoring in creative writing. She/Her.

summary: They won't, it will probably be a different America. They already broke that rule in the comics.
question: They won't, it will probably be a different America. They already broke that rule in the comics.
answer:
[ Regarding America being acknowledged as a Single America across the Marvel Universe ]

I still kinda hope they will, at least indirectly. 

Regarding comics, the only iteration I can think of is Secret Wars because she seemed to cameo in other books where she wasn’t supposed to be but I blame it on writer miscommunication rather than canon error. Also worth noting: they heavily hinted, both at the end of Secret Wars: Siege and during the Ultimates and Ultimates2 runs, that America was well aware of the nature of Battleworld and able to move around it freely and leave it when the time came (supported by her inner dialogue and actions in the Secret Wars Too one-shot). Therefore, her cameos could easily be explained as her moving around to help others across Battleworld. 

The only actual version of her where I know Marvel disregarded her comic background is the Avengers Academy game, which takes place in a different timeline where her mothers are alive and she can come and go to the Utopian Parallel at will. 

Let’s keep our fingers crossed and hope Marvel Rising will at the very least hint to her comic knowledge. It’d be a fun 4th wall break.

(I also still find it hilarious that it means canonically America is part of at least 2 teams atm in different Earths —3 if the Ultimates are still operational which was never cleared out—, and probably belongs to so many other groups across the multiverse. This girl needs a break.)

Regarding comics, the only iteration I can think of is Secret Wars because she seemed to cameo in other books where she wasn’t supposed to be but I blame it on writer miscommunication rather than canon error. Also worth noting: they heavily hinted, both at the end of Secret Wars: Siege and during the Ultimates and Ultimates2 runs, that America was well aware of the nature of Battleworld and able to move around it freely and leave it when the time came (supported by her inner dialogue and actions in the Secret Wars Too one-shot). Therefore, her cameos could easily be explained as her moving around to help others across Battleworld. 

The only actual version of her where I know Marvel disregarded her comic background is the Avengers Academy game, which takes place in a different timeline where her mothers are alive and she can come and go to the Utopian Parallel at will. 

Let’s keep our fingers crossed and hope Marvel Rising will at the very least hint to her comic knowledge. It’d be a fun 4th wall break.

(I also still find it hilarious that it means canonically America is part of at least 2 teams atm in different Earths —3 if the Ultimates are still operational which was never cleared out—, and probably belongs to so many other groups across the multiverse. This girl needs a break.)
trail.content:
[ Regarding America being acknowledged as a Single America across the Marvel Universe ]

I still kinda hope they will, at least indirectly. 

Regarding comics, the only iteration I can think of is Secret Wars because she seemed to cameo in other books where she wasn’t supposed to be but I blame it on writer miscommunication rather than canon error. Also worth noting: they heavily hinted, both at the end of Secret Wars: Siege and during the Ultimates and Ultimates2 runs, that America was well aware of the nature of Battleworld and able to move around it freely and leave it when the time came (supported by her inner dialogue and actions in the Secret Wars Too one-shot). Therefore, her cameos could easily be explained as her moving around to help others across Battleworld. 

The only actual version of her where I know Marvel disregarded her comic background is the Avengers Academy game, which takes place in a different timeline where her mothers are alive and she can come and go to the Utopian Parallel at will. 

Let’s keep our fingers crossed and hope Marvel Rising will at the very least hint to her comic knowledge. It’d be a fun 4th wall break.

(I also still find it hilarious that it means canonically America is part of at least 2 teams atm in different Earths —3 if the Ultimates are still operational which was never cleared out—, and probably belongs to so many other groups across the multiverse. This girl needs a break.)

summary: Marvel!AU: in which young Peter met Tony and decided to become his appprentice, but Tony refuses causing Peter to become an...
caption:
Marvel!AU: in which young Peter met Tony and decided to become his appprentice, but Tony refuses causing Peter to become an actor and join a kabuki theater.
One day he meets Tony by chance and Stark agrees to teach him, but Peter’s apprenticeship doesn’t last long. Tormented by jealousy, Peter runs away and meets a ronin named Deadpool.
